user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_FS_GetPhysDriveName:
```c
int32 OS_FS_GetPhysDriveName(char *PhysDriveName, const char *MountPoint)
{
    OS_object_token_t             token;
    int32                         return_code;
    OS_filesys_internal_record_t *filesys;

    /* Check parameters */
    OS_CHECK_PATHNAME(MountPoint);
    OS_CHECK_POINTER(PhysDriveName);

    /* Get a reference lock, as a filesystem check could take some time. */
    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetBySearch(OS_LOCK_MODE_GLOBAL, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, OS_FileSys_FindVirtMountPoint,
                                         (void *)MountPoint, &token);

    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        filesys = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_filesys_table, token);

        if ((filesys->flags & OS_FILESYS_FLAG_IS_MOUNTED_SYSTEM) != 0)
        {
            strncpy(PhysDriveName, filesys->system_mountpt, OS_FS_PHYS_NAME_LEN - 1);
            PhysDriveName[OS_FS_PHYS_NAME_LEN - 1] = 0;
        }
        else
        {
            return_code = OS_ERR_INCORRECT_OBJ_STATE;
        }

        OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token);
    }
    else
    {
        return_code = OS_ERR_NAME_NOT_FOUND;
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function OS_FS_GetPhysDriveName:
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
strncpy(PhysDriveName, filesys->system_mountpt, OS_FS_PHYS_NAME_LEN - 1);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario:
The call itself does not necessarily violate Rule 8.13: PhysDriveName must be a modifiable (non-const) char * because it is written to by strncpy. The source argument to strncpy is treated as a const char * by the library, so if filesys->system_mountpt is declared as const char * (or an array of char used read-only) then no Rule 8.13 breach occurs.

A specific violation scenario: if the member is declared as a non-const pointer (e.g. "char *system_mountpt" or "char system_mountpt[]") in OS_filesys_internal_record_t but is only ever read (as here), then it should be declared as "const char *system_mountpt" (or "const char[]") and the current declaration would violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13.
